intro: Navarretia aurea, commonly known as the golden navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and Oregon. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Navarretia aurea produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
